timeline.bodyText: For consistency, can you name this "RunFlowWithStemmingEnabledTest"?

timeline.bodyText:
Should this go to develop or 5.4-develop - is there any benefit having it on develop?
If you go to 5.4-develop, you can use the runFlow method that handles everything for you. Actually, that's on develop too.
In any case, don't use Autowired here - that can causes problems with parallel tests since FlowRunnerImpl isn't a thread-safe class.
timeline.author: rjrudin

timeline.bodyText: Just curious, shouldn't a data-hub-developer be able to do this?
timeline.author: rjrudin

timeline.bodyText:
assertTrue/False should really only be used when you're testing against a boolean variable. The problem is that if this fails, you don't see what the two values are.
When you're not sure about case, just lowercase both, though you don't need to do that since JobStatus is already lowercased - so e.g. assertEquals(JobStatus.STOP_ON_ERROR.toString(), resp.getJobStatus().toLowerCase())
timeline.author: rjrudin

timeline.bodyText:
If this is reliable, I think it's a good thing to move up to AbstractHubTest. But for consistency, do "Reindex" instead of "ReIndex", as ML treats it as one word.
I'm also going to open a ticket for this in ml-app-deployer, this would be a nice feature to have in there - e.g. new Database(...).waitForReindex().

timeline.message: DHFPROD-5991:Add test to run flow with stemming searches set to advanced

timeline.bodyText:
I believe there's an issue here in that if the version of ML isn't supported, then the call to set stemmed searches to "off" won't be executed. So I'd just move this to the test.
In fact, I think private methods can make this read nicely:

enableAdvancedStemming();
run the flow and verify an error occurs (I think it'd be good to assert on the contents of stepOutput too, as we can verify there are words in there indicating that a step definition was not found)
reindexDatabase()
run the flow again and verify it succeeds
timeline.author: rjrudin

replies.bodyText: I think moving assumeTrue(new Versions(getHubConfig()).getMLVersion().getMajor() >= 10);  to the first line of setupEach () should resolve that issue right ?

replies.bodyText: Since you only have the one test method, I think it's simpler to just put everything in that method. But if you want to keep the BeforeEach method, then I think assumeTrue will do the trick there.
